channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Mark Humphries
item.description:
Abstract submission is open for the UK Neural Computation meeting 2024 (Sheffield 8-10th July): https://neuralcomputation.uk/A national meeting for everyone interested in the computations of the brain, both experimentally and theoreticallyAbstracts: https://neuralcomputation.uk/submission.html
Deadline of 17th May 2024
4 submitted abstracts will be selected for main meeting talksRegistration: https://neuralcomputation.uk/registration.html
Deadline of 21st June 2024
Discounted accommodation options also available.
8 July: ECR day. ~40 places are available
9-10 July: main meetingPlease spread the word!

item.title: Prof Christina Pagel
item.description: The latest ONS data shows that Long Covid remains a serious issue - we urgently need to find better ways to prevent and treat. Read more on my blog post https://open.substack.com/pub/christinapagel/p/updated-estimates-of-long-covid-in?r=8zv6v&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&showWelcomeOnShare=true

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: 🚨 Short essay in the latest #ComplexityThoughts: Following up on assembly theoryNews from the academic debate around the theory, with two papers.👉 Read/subscribe for free: https://open.substack.com/pub/manlius/p/following-up-on-assembly-theory?r=n4iyo&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&showWelcomeOnShare=true#ComplexSystems

item.description:
An Unpredictable Brain Is a Conscious, Responsive Brain

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Do cicadas know something about prime numbers? For my email newsletter, I wrote about the stubborn mysteries of these insects. https://buttondown.email/carlzimmer/archive/fridays-elk-april-26-2024/

item.title: Michele Giugliano :mastodon:
item.description: @viticci Could http://todotxt.org/ be the open format for task management (extensible with shell scripts, shortcuts, etc.) you were looking for a few weeks ago on your podcast? It is IMHO already there: minimalist, extensible, elegant and with a many mobile apps (see e.g. 2do.txt).

item.title: OUR COMMON GROUND
item.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has called for Supreme Court Justice to be impeached, and says that she is willing to draft and introduce articles of impeachment herself.She said in the announcement:"I just think that if no one's going to introduce it, I would certainly be open to doing so and drafting them myself." She added, "I think this has gone far, far beyond any sort of acceptable standard in any democracy, let alone an American democracy." Dems/public protest support her effort?

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Lab rule: Record everything. http://labrigger.com/blog/2024/04/28/if-you-didnt-record-it-it-doesnt-count/ Not the first time I’ve said it, but I’ve learned that it bears repeating.

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Cool work. Influences also travel in the opposite direction, from waves to spikes. This interaction gives the brain flexibility do to complex things.Human connectome topology directs cortical traveling waves and shapes frequency gradients
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-024-47860-x
#neuroscience

item.title: noyb.eu
item.description: 🚨 noyb has filed a complaint against the ChatGPT creator OpenAIOpenAI openly admits that it is unable to correct false information about people on ChatGPT. The company cannot even say where the data comes from.Read all about it here 👇https://noyb.eu/en/chatgpt-provides-false-information-about-people-and-openai-cant-correct-it

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2024/apr/29/netanyahu-icc-war-crimes

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: +1 to those lauding Brother printers. Bought a monochrome laser printer. Totally painless click-straight-through, default-option-works discovery and configuration under Linux (CUPS) and MacOS. Absolutely nothing to download or install.Their website is a bit confusing (unavailable models seem to clutter the search results), but, once ordered, it's hard to find anything that could be improved.

item.title: John Allsopp
item.description: So many things, big and small have become enshittified and it can feel pretty overwhelming imagining doing anything about it.So I decided to start disenshittifying (@pluralistic's term) stuff one small step at a time. Starting with a QR code creator and a password generator. No ads, no tracking, no shit.And I encourage anyone to join in, or make suggestions!https://deshittify.us/index.html

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Not sure I would have gone with the "Elisabeth Bik is an unreliable judge of blot duplications" defence. Twice.https://pubpeer.com/publications/98784D9AF9B1E8B5B1818E516B5001https://pubpeer.com/publications/52D37ED6C4D16682694521FA04B2BA

item.description: Some tortured phrases are really tortured.https://pubpeer.com/publications/7BF698F86DB67E0E205060425AAC62#2

item.title: Mark Histed
item.description:
Good piece on NIH budget.Except “history of generous budget increases.”
No, not in real dollars.The numerical increases have just balanced inflation, and kept the NIH budget flat since the 1980s. See orange bars in attached graph. 1/3https://www.politico.com/news/2024/04/29/congress-is-killing-bidens-cancer-moonshot-00154718
